snippet: The fledgling South Sudanese government and its army seemed unable to stem the bloodshed between two rival ethnic groups, just six months after the country achieved independence.
abstract: South Sudanese officials seek to confirm whether more than 3,000 villagers were massacred in a burst of communal violence in South Sudan during deadly clash between rival ethnic groups Lou Nuer and Murle; attacks also highlight fact that the fledgling South Sudanese government, which won its independence in July 2011, seems to be unable to stem the bloodshed.
lead_paragraph: The fledgling South Sudanese government and its army seemed unable to stem the bloodshed between two rival ethnic groups, just six months after the country achieved independence.

headline.seo: In South Sudan, Massacre of 3,000 Is Reported
headline.main: Accounts Emerge in South Sudan of 3,000 Deaths in Ethnic Violence
headline.print_headline: Accounts Emerge in South Sudan of 3,000 Deaths in Ethnic Violence

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
